procedures.title: Kidney Transplant Procedures & Specialized Therapies
procedures.subtitle: We tailor every procedure to match the medical, immunological, and lifestyle needs of each patient.

items.name: Living Donor Kidney Transplant
items.description: Ideal for patients who have a compatible family member or altruistic donor. Offers the shortest wait time and highest success rates.
focusPoints: Minimally invasive donor nephrectomy with rapid recovery
Immunosuppression optimization personalized for both donor and recipient

items.name: Deceased Donor Kidney Transplant
items.description: Coordinated via national and international registry partnerships with priority pathways for high-risk renal failure cases.
focusPoints: ABO blood group compatible and ABO-incompatible protocols
Cold ischemia time management using advanced perfusion systems
Immediate post-operative dialysis and graft surveillance

items.name: Paired Kidney Exchange & Swap Programs
items.description: Helps patients with immunological incompatibilities find matching donors through our collaborative pairing network.
focusPoints: Advanced HLA antibody profiling and cross-matching
National registry linkage accelerating match opportunities
Legal and ethical counseling for international donor participation

items.name: Desensitization & High-Risk Transplants
items.description: Enables transplantation for sensitized patients with high antibody titers or positive cross-matches through cutting-edge therapies.
focusPoints: Plasmapheresis, IVIG, and monoclonal antibody therapy
Immunological surveillance with real-time donor-specific antibody tracking
Continuous infection prevention and prophylaxis protocols

journey.title: Your Kidney Transplant Journey
journey.subtitle: A transparent, step-by-step pathway that keeps you informed and supported at every milestone.

steps.title: 1. Referral & Multidisciplinary Evaluation
steps.description: Nephrologists, surgeons, cardiologists, and psychologists conduct a full fitness assessment along with lab and imaging workups.

steps.title: 2. Donor Matching & Readiness
steps.description: We coordinate donor compatibility testing, optimize chronic conditions, and prepare you with nutrition and dialysis support if required.

steps.title: 3. Surgery & Critical Care
steps.description: Our transplant OR and ICU teams perform the surgery, followed by real-time hemodynamic and graft function monitoring.

steps.title: 4. Recovery & Rehabilitation
steps.description: Specialized renal physiotherapists, dietitians, and pharmacists build your recovery plan, focusing on strength, nutrition, and medication adherence.

steps.title: 5. Lifelong Follow-Up
steps.description: Telemedicine check-ins, lab tracking, and adherence coaching ensure sustained graft health and a return to normal life.

journey.note: Families are invited to every planning session so everyone understands the timeline, expectations, and support resources.

symptoms.title: When to See a Kidney Specialist
symptoms.subtitle: Early evaluation can preserve kidney function and prevent complications. Listen to your body and act quickly when these signs appear.

categories.title: Physical Signals
items: Swelling in ankles, feet, or around the eyes that doesn‚Äôt resolve with rest
Persistent fatigue, weakness, or shortness of breath without exertion
Sudden weight gain, loss of appetite, or metallic taste in the mouth

categories.title: Urinary Changes
items: Foamy, bubbly, or dark-colored urine indicating protein or blood loss
Noticeably reduced urine output or increased nighttime urination
Pain or burning sensations during urination accompanied by fever

categories.title: Systemic Red Flags
items: Family history of polycystic kidney disease or autoimmune disorders
Diabetes with worsening kidney function markers (creatinine, eGFR)
